snippet: A new park on Roosevelt Island is based on a plan four decades old: Louis Kahn’s Four Freedoms Park. It opens on Oct. 24 as Kahn’s only work in New York City.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Architecture Review column on Franklin D Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park, which opens Oct 24 on Roosevelt Island; notes park, based on a 40-year-old plan by architect Louis Kahn, his only work in New York City, is a belated and monumental triumph for the city and everyone who cares about architecture and public space.
lead_paragraph: A new park on Roosevelt Island is based on a plan four decades old: Louis Kahn’s Four Freedoms Park. It opens on Oct. 24 as Kahn’s only work in New York City.
